meanings.definition: The central vein or main vein running down the center of a leaf.
meanings.sent1: The midribs of the leaf help transport nutrients.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to damage the midribs when handling delicate leaves.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the midribs of the leaf as a tightrope.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity flowed through her like the midribs of a leaf.
meanings.sent5: The midribs of the leaf stood out like a bold stroke on a canvas.

meanings.definition: The central rib of a fan or umbrella.
meanings.sent1: The midribs of the fan provide structure and support.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally broke the midribs of her umbrella in the strong wind.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat played with the midribs of the fan, causing it to spin wildly.
meanings.sent4: His words held her together like the midribs of an umbrella in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The midribs of the fan spread out like the wings of a bird in flight.

meanings.definition: A ridge in the middle of a road or path.
meanings.sent1: The midribs in the road help with drainage during heavy rain.
meanings.sent2: Be cautious when driving over the midribs to avoid damaging your tires.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous skateboarder enjoyed riding along the midribs of the path.
meanings.sent4: The divide between them felt as wide as the midribs in the road.
meanings.sent5: The midribs of the path guided them like a compass pointing north.
